description.narrative:
Becoming Influencers # Development School
This training program aims to provide ideology, values, knowledge and basis skills for student and young staff of different organizations (especially from business sector), who then participate in solving social issues. They will become the change factors who seek and create opportunities and changes for their society. Instead of complaining and waiting for other#s command, young people should take lead in social movements.
The centre of this project is one#learning space# for young and enthusiasm leaders to learn, connect and support each other. Despite their differences in major fields (environment, poverty reduction, business or technology), they share the same purpose of contributing for a better society, where equality, kindness and human rights are embraced. In another way, #the products# of this project are initiatives and active citizens.
Through lessons and discussions about various issues, participants can experience core values and essential skills. The curriculum will balance knowledge, values and skills. The training program includes interacting with experts and development practitioners, lecturers, self-studyand practicing in NGOs. Participants also have opportunities to start their ownidea and receive technical and financial support.
Training classes will be organized after working hours, at 5 p.m. to 7 p.m. or in weekends. At the end of the course, each participant must summit an essay and develop his/her project. They will receive one Certification of Development Training Course of Institute for studies of Society # Economy and Environment at the end of the course.

participating-org.narrative: Institute for Studies of Society, Economy and Environment

The Institute for Studies of Society Economy and Environment (iSEE) was established in 2007. iSEE now has since grown into an organisation with clear vision, mission and defined strategies to support ethnic minorities, LGBT and people who live with HIV in its owndistinctive ways. Its mission: iSEE is a non-profit Vietnamese organisation that commits itself to protecting the human rights of minorities and the socially excluded. Its institutional objectives are to envision a prosperous, diverse, democratic and just Vietnamese society where minorities are treated equally, and where human rights are fulfilled and protected; to aim to becoming a leading think tank in the field of rights of minorities and the socially excluded in Vietnam. Given the current situation of inequality and exclusion and the level of rights denied, iSEE targets its efforts to the following groups: ethnic minorities; lesbian women, gay men, bi-sexual and transgender people; and people living with HIV (focus on ethnic minorities andgay men in the closet).

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to basic social services
